div.l: A myller was ther duellyng meny a day
As ony pecoc he was proud and gay
Pipe he coude and fisshe and nettis bete
And turne cuppis and wel wrastil ⁊and lepe
And bi his belt he baar a long panade
And of a swerd ful trenchant was þe blaad
A ioli popper baar he in his pouche
Ther was noman for peril durste him touche
A sheffeld thikil bare he in his hose
Round was his face and camoysid was his nose
Also pilid as an Ape was his skulle
He was a market beter at the fulle
Ther durste no wyȝt hond vpon him legge
That he ne swoor anon he sholde abegge
A thef he was forsothe of corn ⁊and mele
And þat a sligh and vsant forto stele
His name was I hote deynos Symkyn̄
A wif he hadde come of nobil kyn̄
The parson of the toun hir fader was
With here he yaf many a panne of bras
For þat Symkyn sholde in his blood alye
She was fostrid in a Nonnerye
For Symkyn wolde nowife as he saide
But if she were wel y norisshid ⁊and amaide
To save his astat of yemanrie
And she was proud ⁊and pert as A pie
A ful feir siȝte was vp on hem two
An holiday beforn hir wolde he go
With his tipet ybounde aboute his hed
And she cam aftir in a gite of reed
And Symkyn hadde hosen of þe same
Ther durste nowiȝt clepe hir but dame
Was non so hardy þat wente be þe way
That with hir durste onys rage or play
But if he wolde be slayn of Symkyn̄
With panade or with knyf or bodekyn̄
For ielous folk ben parlous euermo
Algatis þey wolde her wivis wenten so fostering collatio
